Forsberg, Mike wrote on 12/11/09 07:10 AM:
>  
> 
> I for one 100% agree that reading system properties during a static 
> initializer leads to untestable-like code. I think there are a few 
> articles out there that frown against it. No one likes dealing with the 
> class loader if they don't have to.
> 
> However, using system properties in something like object construction 
> is a good idea. (In my opinion.) In fact I like it soo much I'm going to 
> blog about it. But my first rough draft has the template you need. (It 
> is currently the second code snippet.) The idea is to save the system 
> properties in a before method and restore in an after method. Then set 
> the property you want to change before constructing the object. In your 
> case it would be before loading the class.

Right, but unless I use a custom class loader, I only get to load the
class once.
